description: Hepatology involves the study of the liver, related organs and structures, and related diseases. In addition to the liver, hepatology also includes exocrine functions of the gallbladder, bile ducts, and pancreas. The liver has more than 500 key functions, so its central role in drug metabolism is essential for drug developers. With the rapid development of this therapeutic field, many indications are actively being researched for innovation of new therapies and dosage forms.
name: the Hepatology
